title: Unscientific
alt: Last week, we busted the myth that electroweak gauge symmetry is broken by the Higgs mechanism. We'll also examine the existence of God and whether true love exists.
transcript:
[Cueball and Megan are sitting on a coach, watching Mythbusters.]
TV: Can a ninja catch an arrow? On this episode, we'll find out!
Cueball: Mmm, science.
Megan: Hey, Mythbusters is entertaining, but it's not science.Zombie Feynman: BRAAAAAIIINNS...
Cueball: Zombie Feynman!
Zombie Feynman: You got a problem with Mythbusters?
Megan: They fail at basic rigor!Zombie Feynman: "Ideas are tested by experiment." That is the core of science. Everything else is bookkeeping.Zombie Feynman: By teaching people to hold their beliefs up to experiment, Mythbusters is doing more to drag humanity out of the unscientific darkness than a thousand lessons in rigor. Show them some love.Zombie Feynman: Anyway, back to zombie stuff. I hunger for BRAAAAAIIINNS!
Cueball: Uh, try the physics lab next door.
Zombie Feynman: I said brains. All they've got are string theorists.
